node.title: 'The bulk of this savaging, I deserve': Reporter issues on-air apology for botched Adele interview
node.alt: Adele smiles, looking towards the camera
node.description: The Australian TV reporter who was widely criticised for flying to the UK to interview singer Adele without listening to her new album issuesÂ an on-air apology, admitting he made a "terrible mistake".
node.content:
["An Australian TV reporter who was widely criticised for flying to the UK to interview singer Adele without listening to her new album\u00a0has issued an on-air apology, admitting he made a \"terrible mistake\".", "Seven Network's Matt Doran said the email he had been sent which contained a link to a pre-release copy of the album was \"the most important email that I've missed in my life\".", "Sony reportedly refused to release the footage of the interview \u2014 which had been arranged as part of a deal between the record company and Channel Seven \u2014 after Doran said he had\u00a0not listened to the album, 30, which has since gone to number 1 in the UK.", "In his monologue at the end of Seven's Weekend Sunrise program on\u00a0Saturday, Doran said the event had precipitated \"a torrent of abuse and mockery\".", "He said having the opportunity to interview the Grammy award-winner was\u00a0\"an unspeakable privilege\" and one of\u00a0the highlights of his career.", "", "
Matthew Doran issued the apology at the end\u00a0of Saturday's Weekend Sunrise show.(Supplied: Channel Seven)
", "Doran said\u00a0\"at least half\" the interview was on the new music but that it would have been \"reductive\" to describe the album as \"simply being about divorce\".", "He apologised to Adele, saying he would \"never have knowingly disrespected\" her by deliberately not listening to the album.", "\"I also apologise to Adele's Australian fans, and to you, our viewers.\"", "Doran is no relation to the ABC reporter of the same name, who tweeted \"go easy on me\" \u2014 the name of a track on the new album \u2014 when news of the failed interview became public."]
